text:
- I'm Stephen Manley,
I'm the CTO at Druva.
Generative AI is reshaping my industry,
which is data protection and security,
because it's enabling customers
to finally use all the functionality
that's inside the product
without having to be experts at it.

It's enabling them to
finally get the full value
of what they're paying for.

The biggest misconception
about generative AI

in the general public
is that it's really easy

because they see all
those public interfaces,
which are fun and easy to play with,

but to actually build it
into an enterprise product,
there's a lot of work and a lot of tooling
and a lot of support to make that happen.

The important thing is that
you pick the right tools

and the right architecture,
in our case, Amazon Bedrock,
to make sure that security is built in
so that you can focus on delivering value
as fast as possible.
Now, AWS supports us in two critical ways
on our gen AI journey.
The first is foundational,

and we need to be able to
access data, store data,
and feed data into gen AI models,
and our foundation is Amazon S3 storage.

The second key value
came from Amazon Bedrock

and we didn't want to
invest a whole lot of money
in infrastructure

before we started
realizing value out of AI.
Amazon Bedrock, in addition to security,
enables us to pay for what we use
so we can get value almost instantly
without a big capital investment.

AWS helps my software
company to be more innovative

because it takes care
of all the hard problems

so we can just focus on
helping our customers.
(upbeat music)
